QA.q: What exactly happened after we moved to the parallel street?
QA.a: After moving to the parallel street, our ego-car then proceeded to merge into the center lane of this new street we've transitioned onto.

QA.q: What difficulty did the car face while merging into the leftmost lane?
QA.a: Our ego-car had to wait for another vehicle to pass before it could successfully merge into the leftmost lane. This presented a brief pause in our movement.

QA.q: What was the direction we were headed towards after this?
QA.a: After the leftmost lane merge, our ego-car strategically moved into a left turn lane, indicating that we were moving towards an intersection next.

QA.q: How did our car respond as we approached the intersection?
QA.a: As our ego-car moved down the turn lane and got closer to the intersection, it started slowing down and eventually came to a stop because the traffic light had turned red.

QA.q: What could we potentially anticipate the driver might have done if the light hadn't turned red?
QA.a: If the light hadn't turned red, it's reasonable to infer that our driver might have continued to drive through the intersection without stopping. However, due to traffic regulations, the driver had to stop the car at the red light to ensure safety.

QA.q: Why was the car moving slowly at the beginning?
QA.a: The car in front of our ego-car was moving slowly, which was why our car had to reduce its speed.

QA.q: Why did the car make a swerve movement?
QA.a: The ego-car made an attempt to pass the slow-moving car in front but swerved back because of other traffic blocking the overtake.

QA.q: When the car was trying to go around slow traffic, could it instantly get to the left lane?
QA.a: No. The car had to merge into the left lane slowly due to the slower traffic in its current lane.

QA.q: Did the car have to stop during its journey?
QA.a: Yes, the car had to stop and start several times because the traffic in front of it was stopping and starting.

QA.q: What action did the car take when another car was trying to merge into its lane?
QA.a: The ego-car slowed down to allow another car to merge into its lane safely.

QA.q: Towards the end of the journey, how was the general traffic situation?
QA.a: The traffic was heavy towards the end, which caused the ego-car to move at a slow pace.

QA.q: How might the traffic conditions have affected the journey if it was not as congested?
QA.a: If the traffic were not as congested, our ego-car might have been able to maintain a constant speed and wouldn't have to stop and start repeatedly. The journey time could have been shorter as well.

QA.q: Considering the heavy traffic, was there any pedestrian movement that the driver needed to be careful about?
QA.a: Yes, there were a few instances where pedestrians were detected, the driver needed to be vigilant about their movement to ensure safety.

QA.q: What could happened if the ego-car hadn't slowed down while another car was merging into its lane?
QA.a: If the ego-car hadn't slowed down to allow the other car to merge, it could have led to an accident or at least a close contact situation. It is essential in such situations to adjust speed and maintain distance ensuring a safe driving environment.

QA.q: How would you describe the initial positioning of the ego-car and other cars on the road when we first started moving?
QA.a: In the beginning, the ego-car and a few other vehicles were present in the vicinity. The ego-car was in motion, trying to reverse slowly into a parking spot. The other cars were positioned in varied areas around the ego-car but not close enough to pose any immediate danger.

QA.q: Could you tell me if there were any pedestrians around while the ego-car was moving into the parking spot?
QA.a: From the time the car initiated moving into the parking spot until it was properly positioned, there was indeed a pedestrian present. The pedestrian appeared on the scene after about 4 seconds into the parking maneuver.

QA.q: Once we parked, how did the scene change in terms of vehicle count and type in the vicinity?
QA.a: Once the car was parked, the scenario did change quite significantly. Along with a few cars, a new entity, a bus, also appeared in view. There were a few more vehicles near the ego-car than there were when we first started parking but none posed an immediate threat due to distance.

QA.a: If another car was moving towards our parking spot while we were trying to park, it could have created a potentially unsafe situation. Depending on the speed and proximity of the other car, the driver might have had to pause or alter the parking maneuver. This could have resulted in the need for additional adjustments to ensure proper positioning in the parking spot. It would certainly require careful attention and alertness on part of the driver.
